p: In a mildly written primal scream, Wenning ( 2020) laid out the myriad ways in which an administration that values neither science nor environmental protection can and had rolled back environmental and public health measures in just 1 term. Although now, a new, weeks‐old (as of this writing) administration has rejoined the Paris Climate Accord, reversed some major initiatives, and elevated science to the Cabinet level, precious time was and is dribbling away. With each passing year, the global impacts of our actions become more apparent and less reversible. Attanasio ( 2020) explored the concept of “ecological grief,” resilience, and the balance between dispassionate science and an acknowledgement of deep trauma and loss. Our choices, in balancing avoidance, mitigation, and adaptation measures become more limited, and potentially less effective, as time passes.
